page.title: 20FOX HUNTING IN COUNTESTHORPE
page.content: Fox Hunting is a Countesthorpe tradition that has been going on for many years.Over a hundred people on their horses and twenty five dogs trample around the areas countryside, in the four winter months and sometimes in the summer.You can sometimes hear the sound of a bugle echoing over the fields during the day long hunt. For over fifty years, Jack Clark a well known local farmer, had been running the Fernie Hunt until he sadly died last year. In many of the fields the hedges have been trimmed down to provide a jumping place for the horses. After a small survey had been conducted we found out that the majority of people were against the sport.
